intro: Elateriopsis grisebachii, commonly known as the gray leaved elateriopsis, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small, star-shaped, and often pale or yellowish in color. Elateriopsis grisebachii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
